discussion.content: Since it is Software firewall, answer shd be A. Application

comments.content:
ISA Server 2004 is a software firewall ... Microsoft defines ISA Server 2004 as “an advanced application layer firewall ... ISA Server 2004 includes the following key features: multi-layer inspection, advanced application layer filtering, secure inbound traffic and protection from “inside attacks” via VPN client connections, integrated multi-networking capabilities, network templates, and stateful routing and inspection. 


Sounds like a NGFW but i mean. Yeah definitely should be A IMO

discussion.content:
Point is not, if firewall is or not an application. Is, obviously. And as application, that fw works at OSI layer 7.

Point is, what OSI layer that fw is inspecting. If you filter based on IP address (for example), you can say that your firewall is filtering at layer 3. If you filter specific ports, you can say you're filtering at layer 4. If your firewall inspects specific protocol states or data, you can say it operates at layer 7.

Software fw usually inspects OSI layer 2 pdus. So, data link :)

questions.question_text: Software firewalls work at which layer of the OSI model?

choices.B: NAT does not work with stateful firewalls
choices.A: Stateful firewalls do not work with packet filtering firewalls
choices.C: IPSEC does not work with packet filtering firewalls
choices.D: NAT does not work with IPSEC

questions.question_text: After passing her CEH exam, Carol wants to ensure that her network is completely secure. She implements a DMZ, stateful firewall, NAT, IPSEC, and a packet filtering firewall. Since all security measures were taken, none of the hosts on her network can reach the Internet. Why is that?

discussion.content:
Here is a quote from: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/i/7.3?topic=concepts-nat-compatible-ipsec-udp
"Unfortunately, conventional NAT does not work on IPSec packets because when the packet goes through a NAT device, the source address in the packet changes, thereby invalidating the packet."
Nat does work with upset, it uses port 4500 and its referred to as nat-t or nat traversal

questions.question_text: You are running known exploits against your network to test for possible vulnerabilities. To test the strength of your virus software, you load a test network to mimic your production network. Your software successfully blocks some simple macro and encrypted viruses. You decide to really test the software by using virus code where the code rewrites itself entirely and the signatures change from child to child, but the functionality stays the same. What type of virus is this that you are testing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Metamorphic malware is the one which translates and changes itself or you can say re-write it's code with each iteration so that it can be difficult for the anti-malware software to identify its signature or pattern. The longer the malware stays in a system, the more iteration it produces and the more sophisticated the iterations are, making it increasingly hard for antivirus applications to detect or diffuse it. Polymorphic malware works by encrypting itself with a variable encryption key since the keys used for encryption are different so each copy looks different. But the virus decryption routine would remain constant and because of this static part of code, it gets easy for an antivirus program to identify the malware.

https://pediaa.com/difference-between-polymorphic-and-metamorphic-virus/ 

Just a bad question again. Both polymorphic and metamorphic rewrite their code to avoid detection. Poly encrypts itself being the only difference

choices.A: The IP address of the employees' computers
choices.C: The employees network usernames and passwords
choices.B: Bank account numbers and the corresponding routing numbers
choices.D: The MAC address of the employees' computers

discussion.content: idk if the question answers were written correctly. A better answer would be : Potential end user passwords and corresponding usernames. You cant guarantee that youre getting exact network usernames and passwords but its likely

questions.question_text: As a security analyst, you setup a false survey website that will require users to create a username and a strong password. You send the link to all the employees of the company. What information will you be able to gather?
What will the following command accomplish?

choices.D: Test the ability of a router to handle fragmented packets
choices.A: Test ability of a router to handle over-sized packets
choices.B: Test the ability of a router to handle under-sized packets
choices.C: Test the ability of a WLAN to handle fragmented packets
